results.title: Owning Mahowny
results.creator_credit: Richard Kwietniowski, Seaton McLean, Andras Hamori, Alessandro Camon, Natural Nylon, H2O Motion Pictures and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: Impressive thriller about a mild-mannered, nebbish bank manager who, due to an obsessive gambling addiction, embezzles the bank where he works for several million dollars. Phillip Seymour Hoffman plays Dan Mahowny as a man whose self-delusions run deep, and whose desire to not only to remain in denial but also to keep his covert life secret from others, leads to extreme measures. What makes the film interesting is the way that Dan’s obsession and subsequent daring embezzlement builds slowly, spiralling out of his control. Hoffman depicts a man deluded but also conflicted by his choices that results in a great deal of suffering. Based on a true story.

results.title: Decades of steam : the 1950's, setting the scene
results.creator_credit: Jeremy English and Ian Allan Limited
results.brief_description: This is the fourth in the series of five videos tracing the story of steam locomotives during the middle of the 20th century. In this episode the steam locomotive was seen as an anachronism which had to be replaced by “modern” power. However, British Railways had over 20,000 steam engines at the beginning of the decade, to which it added a further 999 examples- the well known Standard types. We trace the last full decade of steam locomotive development by examing each of the regions of British Railways, setting the scene for steam’s final years. Narrated by Ken Morgan.

results.title: Decades of steam : the 1940's, austerity and nationalisation
results.creator_credit: Jeremy English and Ian Allan Limited
results.brief_description: This is the third in the series of five videos tracing the story of steam locomotives during the middle years of the 20th century. In this episode the story of steam locomotives is taken through the end of independence into the early days of Nationalisation. The first half of the decade saw the railways at the forefront of the war effort, from which the black painted steam locomotives emerged bloodied but unbowed, still the principal power force on the railways. 1948 was to see a unified system, with Nationalisation. We see them on trial and bearing their new owner’s name in full - “British Railways”. We see postwar type engines and also some prewar survivors including the most radical of all, the Bulleid Pacific of the Southern. Narrated by Ken Morgan.

results.title: Overseas and undersold. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Paul Hawker, Bob Hill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Part two of a two part series examining Australia’s international relations with overseas markets. Each episode gives a detailed background to individual markets and territories, as well as examining the financial opportunities available to Australian business. The series also examines mistakes made by Australian business in pursuing international competitiveness. Includes interviews with business leaders, economists and politicians. This volume examines the economies of Thailand, New Zealand, the Middle East and the United States. The last episode of this volume is a summation of the changes in Australian markets over the last decade.

results.title: Decades of steam : the 1920's, the big four
results.creator_credit: Jeremy English and Ian Allan Limited
results.brief_description: This is the first in the series of five videos tracing the story of steam locomotives during the middle years of the 20th century. In this episode we look at the great amalgamation - the grouping - of the Victorian companies in 1923 to form the “Big Four” railways: the Great Western, the Southern, the London, Midland and Scottish and the London & North Eastern. Using previously unseen archival film of the 1920’s, we examine the stock inherited by the “Big Four” and then look at the first new types introduced by the “Big Four”. Many rare scenes are shown and many locomotives shown including the Great Western “Dukes”, the “Lord Nelsons”, the “Atlantics” and the A1 “Pacifics”. Narrated by Ken Morgan.

results.title: Death: coping with loss
results.creator_credit: Larry Pont, Bill Mackie and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Presents discussions of fears about dying, terminal illness, responding to loss, funerals and comforting the bereaved. Examines reactions and attitudes of various people towards death.

results.title: Death on the Nile
results.creator_credit: John Guillermin, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: A star-studded cast features in this version of a great Agatha Christie classic story. Peter Ustinov stars as the famous Belgian detective Hercule Poirot investigating the murder of rich American heiress Lynette Ridgeway on board a Nile steamer. All the passengers including her newly acquired husband have reason to want her dead and it is Poirot who puts “his little grey cells” to work and solves the mystery. Beautifully costumed, starring Jane Birkin, Lois Chiles, Bette Davis, Mia Farrow, Jon Finch, Olivia Hussey, I.S. Johar, George Kennedy, Angela Lansbury, Simon MacCorkindale, David Niven, Maggie Smith and Jack Warden.

results.title: Death warmed up
results.creator_credit: David Blyth, Murray Newey and Tucker Production Company
results.brief_description: Michael Tucker (Michael Hurst) is programmed to kill his parents by genetic surgeon, Dr Archer Howell (Gary Day) and is incarcerated in a psychiatric institution for the crime. Years later, Michael and friends travel to an isolated Island where Howell now runs Transcranial Applications, experimenting on humans and turning them into mutant killing machines. Michael seeks revenge on Howell for the death of his parents but also to stop him for the sake of mankind. Co-starring Margaret Umbers, William Upjohn, Norelle Scott, Bruno Lawrence and David Letch.

results.title: Keep moving
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Full of Life”.
Promotes the importance of regular exercise including the positive effects of physical exertion and eating the correct foods. Designed to trigger young people’s interest in wanting to include exercise as a regular part of a balanced lifestyle.

results.title: Death row
results.creator_credit: Bruce Jackson, Diane Christian and Documentary Research
results.brief_description: The film portrays the daily life of 114 men housed in the special death cells of Ellis prison, Texas. Some of the condemned men discuss their relationships with their families and attorneys and how they fill the years between fixing of a death sentence by a judge and ultimate resolution in freedom, commutation or death by lethal injection.
